cves.description: HAX CMS allows users to manage their microsite universe with a NodeJS or PHP backend. In haxcms-nodejs versions 11.0.12 and below and in haxcms-php versions 11.0.7 and below, all pages within the HAX CMS application do not contain headers to prevent other websites from loading the site within an iframe. This applies to both the CMS and generated sites. An unauthenticated attacker can load the standalone login page or other sensitive functionality within an iframe, performing a UI redressing attack (clickjacking). This can be used to perform social engineering attacks to attempt to coerce users into performing unintended actions within the HAX CMS application. This is fixed in haxcms-nodejs version 11.0.13 and haxcms-php 11.0.8.
problemType: CWE-1021: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames

cves.description: A potential security vulnerability has been identified in the Poly Clariti Manager for versions prior to 10.12.2. The vulnerability could allow a bypass of the application's XSS filter by submitting untrusted characters. HP has addressed the issue in the latest software update.

versions.version: See HP Security Bulletin reference for affected versions.

problemType: CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting')

cves.description: A potential privilege escalation through Sudo vulnerability has been identified in the Poly Clariti Manager for versions prior to 10.12.2. The firmware flaw does not properly implement access controls. HP has addressed the issue in the latest software update.

versions.version: See HP Security Bulletin reference for affected versions.

cves.description:
A potential stored cross-site scripting vulnerability has been
identified in the Poly Clariti Manager for versions prior to 10.12.1. The
website allows user input to be stored and rendered without proper
sanitization. HP has addressed the issue in the latest software update.

versions.version: See HP Security Bulletin reference for affected versions.

problemType: CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting')
